questions.qText: What is the function of an emulsifying agent in stabilizing emulsions?

qOptions: They have a larger surface area
They have a longer shelf life

qOptions: Water dispersed in oil (W/O) type and Oil dispersed in water (O/W) type

questions.qText: Which of the following colloidal systems describe emulsions?

To remove colouring matter from pure substances the activated charcoal is used. It works by
Which gas will be adsorbed on a solid to greater extent?
The correct variation for adsorption of a gases on a solid surface with pressure of the gas, in the following manner is
qOptions: Slow → fast → independent of the pressure
Fast → slow → independent of the pressure
Independent of the pressure → fast → slow
Independent of the pressure → slow → fast

questions.qText: The process of removing dissolved impurities from a colloidal system by means of diffusion through suitable membrane under the influence of an electric field is called
Which one of the following statements is not correct?
qOptions: The value of equilibrium constant is changed in the presence of a catalyst in the reaction at equilibrium
Coenzymes increase the catalytic activity of enzyme
Catalyst does not initiate any reaction

questions.qText: Which of the following type of catalysis can be explained by the adsorption theory?
Which is the correct characteristic of catalyst?
qOptions: Alters the equilibrium in a reaction
Is always in the same phase as the reactants
Participates in the reaction and provides easier pathway for the same
Does not participate in the reaction

questions.qText: When a sulphur sol is evaporated sulphur is obtained. On mixing with water sulphur sol is not formed. The sol is
Which of the following is not correct for enzyme catalysis?
qOptions: The enzyme activity is maximum at optimum pH which is between 5–7
Each enzyme is specific for a given reaction
The enzymatic activity is increased in presence of certain substances called co-enzymes
The favourable temperature range of enzyme activity is between 50–60 \(^\circ\)C

questions.qText: After the reaction is over between adsorbed reactants, it is important to create space for the other reactant molecules to approach the surface and react. The process responsible for this is known as
One desires to prepare a positively charged silver iodide sol. This can be achieved by
qOptions: Adding a little AgNO\(_3\) solution to KI solution in slight excess
Adding a little KI solution to AgNO\(_3\) solution in slight excess
Mixing equal volumes of equimolar solutions of AgNO\(_3\) and KI

questions.qText: 1 mol of AgI/AgI^- is coagulated by
The potential difference between the fixed charged layer and the diffused layer having opposite charge is called:
According to the adsorption theory of catalysis, the rate of reaction increases because
qOptions: adsorption lowers the activation energy of the reaction
concentration of reactant molecules at the active centres of the catalyst becomes high due to adsorption
adsorption produces heat which increases the rate of reaction
adsorption increases the activation energy of the reaction

questions.qText: Which of the following statement is incorrect regarding physisorption?
qOptions: More easily liquefiable gases are adsorbed readily
Under high pressure it results into multi molecular layer on adsorbent surface
Enthalpy of adsorption \(\Delta H_{\text{adsorption}}\) is low and positive
It occurs because of van der Waal's forces

qOptions: Increases first and decreases later with pressure

questions.qText: Which of the following electrolytes will be most effective in the coagulation of gold sol

The Langmuir adsorption isotherm is deduced using the assumption
qOptions: the adsorption sites are equivalent in their ability to adsorb the particles
the heat of adsorption varies with coverage
the adsorbed molecules interact with each other
the adsorption takes place in multi layers

questions.qText: A micelle formed during the cleansing action by soap is
qOptions: aggregated particles of soap and dirt
an aggregated particle of dust and water

questions.qText: Among the colloids cheese (C), milk (M) and smoke (S), the correct combination of the dispersed phase and dispersion medium respectively are
qOptions: C: solid in liquid; M: solid in liquid; S: solid in gas
C: solid in liquid; M: liquid in liquid; S: gas in solid
C: liquid in solid; M: liquid in solid; S: solid in gas
C: liquid in solid; M: liquid in liquid; S: solid in gas

questions.qText: The Brownian motion is due to
qOptions: Temperature fluctuation within the liquid phase
Attraction and repulsion between charges on the colloidal particles
Impact of the molecules of the dispersion medium on the colloidal particles

questions.qText: Which of the following statement about zeolites is not correct?
qOptions: Zeolites are open structures of silica in which trivalent aluminium is substituted by a fraction of silicon atoms
Shape selectivity of zeolites depends upon porous structures of the catalyst
Zeolites are synthetic microporous aluminosilicates which do not exist naturally
Zeolites are aluminosilicates having three dimensional network

questions.qText: To stop bleeding from cut we use ferric chloride, it is because
qOptions: Fe\(^{3+}\) ion coagulates blood, which is a negatively charged sol
Fe\(^{3+}\) ion coagulates blood, which is a positively charged sol
Cl\(^-\) coagulates blood, which is a positively charged sol
Cl\(^-\) ion coagulates blood, which is a negatively charged sol

questions.qText: Which of the following mixture will lead to the formation of negatively charged colloid \([\text{AgI}]^-\) ?
qOptions: 50 mL of 0.1 M AgNO\(_3\) + 50 mL of 0.1 M KI
50 mL of 0.1 M AgNO\(_3\) + 50 mL of 0.2 M KI
50 mL of 0.2 M AgNO\(_3\) + 50 mL of 0.1 M KI
50 mL of 0.2 M AgNO\(_3\) + 50 mL of 0.2 M KI

questions.qText: Powdered substances are more effective adsorbents than their crystalline form because
qOptions: they become inert and do not react with the adsorbate
the extent of adsorption increases with increases in surface area of the adsorbent
adsorption is more if the size of adsorbent is small

questions.qText: Gold number of a lyophilic sol is such a property that
qOptions: The larger its value, the greater is the peptizing power
The lower its value, the greater is the protecting power
The larger its value, the greater is the protecting power
The lower its value, the greater is the peptizing power

questions.qText: Which is correct in case of van der Waal's adsorption?
Position of non-polar and polar parts in micelle is:
qOptions: polar at the outer surface but nonpolar at the inner surface
polar at the inner surface but nonpolar at the outer surface
are present in the surface only

Bleeding is stopped by the application of ferric chloride. This is because:
qOptions: The blood starts flowing in opposite direction
The blood reacts and forms a solid, which seals the blood vessel
The blood is coagulated and thus the blood vessel is sealed
The ferric chloride seals the blood vessel

qOptions: Magnesium chloride solution coagulates the gold solution more readily than the iron(III) hydroxide solution
Sodium sulphate solution causes coagulation in both the solutions
Coagulation in both solutions can be brought about by electrophoresis
Mixing of the solutions has no effect

questions.qText: The correct option among the following is:
